Nerangs.ab: pas yə̄ səuuištō ahurō mazdā̊scā ārmaitišcā aṣ̌əmcā frādat̰.gaēϑəm manascā vohū ḫšaϑrəmcā sraotā.mōi mərəždātā.mōi hum va urvarān ašvārdan ādāi kahiiāicīt̰ paitī har se bār ḫᵛāndan pas dast andar hāvan nahādan ān sokure-e farāhum-ḫᵛor bar-ruy-e hāvan daste nahādan va ān sokure ke šib-e hum-pyāle nahāde ast ke-š farāhum andar-ast be-dast-e rāst bar dāštan yek qaṯre be-sokure-ruy-e hāvan kardan bāqi andar farāhum-dān kardan digar yekqaṯre be sokure-ye farāhum-dān kardan

"Then, (he should recite) yə̄ səuuištō ahurō mazdā̊scā ārmaitišcā aṣ̌əmcā frādat̰.gaēϑəm manascā vohū ḫšaϑrəmcā sraotā.mōi mərəždātā.mōi, squeeze the hum and urvarān (and continue with) ādāi kahiiāicīt̰ paitī. He should recite (this stanza) three times. Then he should touch the hāwan with his hand and place the cup for drinking the farāhum on the hāvan and pestle. He has then to take with the right hand the cup that was placed under the hum-pyāle and in which is contained the farāhum and pour a drop into the cup placed on the hāvan. He should pour the rest into the farāhum-dān and pour again a drop into the farāhum-dān."
